V1: 132 kt

VR: 132 kt
SEL OAT: +59 C
V2: 139 kt

options.text: SEL OAT wil force the engine control computer to think the air temprature is +59C and therefore that the air density is low and the engine requires less fuel to maintain the correct fuel/air ratio.this leads to less thrust being produced.

SEL OAT is a parameter that is used to modify the take-off performance calculation in order find the appropriate thrust setting and is NOT entered in any aeroplane systems. The aeroplane can only work with the actual air temprature.

By entering the SEL OAT value the engine will produce a greater amount of thrust since a higher SEL OAT value will tell the engine that the air is warmer. This m that more feul is required to maintain the thrust when the air is less dense.

The SEL value will only be considered when it is lower than the air temprature at the airport. it is the lowest of either the SEL OAT or the airport air temprature that determines the take-off thrust for the engines.
